name: OpenAlex 5: Get list of works by search term
description:
This preset accompanies the fifth tutorial of our [Getting Started with OpenAlex](https://github.com/strohne/Facepager/wiki/Getting-Started-with-OpenAlex) guide.  

It retrieves a list of scholarly works by one or more arbitrary search terms as a seed nodes. For starters, add a seed node (e.g., computational methods) to get all works containing this text string in their title, abstract, or full-text. The query will return a list of works each designated by its unique OpenAlexID.  For now the preset limits the number of calls to 100. Up the *per-page* parameter to fetch more. 

The results are sorted by their publication year. Of course that is only one way to arrange the results. Refer to [OpenAlex' documentation](https://docs.openalex.org/how-to-use-the-api/get-lists-of-entities/sort-entity-lists) to learn about your options.

To obtain the metadata of any work, apply the "OpenAlex: Get a single work" preset, select the node(s) of interest, and hit Fetch data once more. 

Please note that each user is allowed a maximum of 100,000 API calls per day and 10 API calls per second. If you need a higher limit, you can register for [OpenAlex Premium](https://openalex.org/pricing).
